Property.name: OfficialName
Property.val: INVASIVE CARCINOMA OF THE BREAST: Resection

Property.name: Restrictions
Property.val: Please refer to the cancer protocol cover page (www.cap.org/cancerprotocols) for information about which tumor types and procedures can be reported using this template.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_16073
DisplayedItem.title: Note: If there are multiple invasive carcinomas, size, grade, histologic type, and the results of studies for estrogen receptor (ER), progesterone receptor (PR), and HER2 should pertain to the largest invasive carcinoma. If smaller invasive carcinomas differ in any of these features, this information may be included in the "Comments" section.

ListItem.name: LI_39079
ListItem.title: Total mastectomy (including nipple-sparing and skin-sparing mastectomy)

ListItem.name: LI_51172
ListItem.title: Specify distance from nipple in Centimeters (cm)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_16271
DisplayedItem.title: Note: Determination of histologic type is based on routine histologic examination; special stains such as e-cadherin are not required for determining histologic type. The histologic type corresponds to the largest carcinoma. If there are smaller carcinomas of a different type, this information should be included under “Additional Findings.”

DisplayedItem.name: DI_33661
DisplayedItem.title: Note: Special type carcinomas should consist of at least 90% pure pattern.

ListItem.name: LI_16280
ListItem.title: Invasive carcinoma of no special type (ductal)

ListItem.name: LI_16284
ListItem.title: Invasive carcinoma with mixed ductal and lobular features

ListItem.name: LI_16290
ListItem.title: Invasive carcinoma, type cannot be determined

ListItem.name: LI_16347
ListItem.title: Score 1 (> 75% of tumor area forming glandular / tubular structures)

ListItem.name: LI_16348
ListItem.title: Score 2 (10 to 75% of tumor area forming glandular / tubular structures)

ListItem.name: LI_16349
ListItem.title: Score 3 (< 10% of tumor area forming glandular / tubular structures)

ListItem.name: LI_16354
ListItem.title: Score 1 (Nuclei small with little increase in size in comparison with normal breast epithelial cells, regular outlines, uniform nuclear chromatin, little variation in size)

ListItem.name: LI_16355
ListItem.title: Score 2 (Cells larger than normal with open vesicular nuclei, visible nucleoli, and moderate variability in both size and shape)

ListItem.name: LI_16356
ListItem.title: Score 3 (Vesicular nuclei, often with prominent nucleoli, exhibiting marked variation in size and shape, occasionally with very large and bizarre forms)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_35644
DisplayedItem.title: Note: See Table 1 in CAP Protocol.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_16343
DisplayedItem.title: Note: The grade corresponds to the largest area of invasion. If there are smaller foci of invasion of a different grade, this information should be included under "Additional Findings."

DisplayedItem.name: DI_33514
DisplayedItem.title: Note: The size of the invasive carcinoma should take into consideration the gross findings correlated with the microscopic examination. If multiple foci of invasion are present, the size listed is the size of the largest contiguous area of invasion. The size of multiple invasive carcinomas should not be added together. The size does not include adjacent ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS). For any carcinoma larger than 1.0 mm but less than 1.5 mm, the size should not be rounded down to 1.0 mm, but rather rounded up to 2.0 mm, to ensure that the tumor is not miscategorized as pT1mi. Exception to the size rule-if two histologically similar carcinomas are within 5.0 mm of each other, measure from outer edges of the two. For staging purposes radiologic findings can be used for pT category.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_30139
DisplayedItem.title: If there has been a prior core needle biopsy or incisional biopsy showing a larger area of invasion than in the excisional specimen, the largest dimension of the invasive carcinoma in the prior specimen should be used for T classification, if known. This also applies if the entire tumor has been removed by prior biopsy The size of the largest foci in the two specimens should not be added together.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_59251
DisplayedItem.title: If there has been prior neoadjuvant treatment and no invasive carcinoma is present, the cancer is classified as ypTis if there is residual DCIS and ypT0 if there is no remaining carcinoma. A checklist is not required if no cancer is present in the specimen.

ListItem.name: LI_31357
ListItem.title: Greatest dimension of largest invasive focus > 1 mm (specify exact measurement in Millimeters (mm))

Property.name: p_rptTxt_31357_1
Property.val: Greatest dimension of largest invasive focus (Millimeters)

ListItem.name: LI_16263
ListItem.title: Size of largest invasive focus cannot be determined (explain)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_16263_1
Property.val: Size of largest invasive focus cannot be determined

DisplayedItem.name: DI_58057
DisplayedItem.title: Note: If there are multiple invasive carcinomas, size, grade, histologic type, and the results of studies for estrogen receptor (ER), progesterone receptor (PgR), and HER2 should pertain to the largest invasive carcinoma. If smaller invasive carcinomas differ in any of these features, this information may be included in the “Comments” section.

Section.name: S_43746
Section.title: # Note: Sizes of individual foci may be repeated as needed or recorded on a single line.

Question.name: Q_16451
Question.title: Sizes of Individual Foci in Millimeters (mm)#

DisplayedItem.name: DI_38127
DisplayedItem.title: Note: If there has been prior neoadjuvant treatment and only residual DCIS, the cancer is classified as ypTis.

ListItem.name: LI_16313
ListItem.title: Only DCIS is present after presurgical (neoadjuvant) therapy

DisplayedItem.name: DI_16315
DisplayedItem.title: Note: The size (extent) of DCIS (greatest dimension using gross and microscopic evaluation) is an estimation of the volume of breast tissue occupied by DCIS. This information may be helpful for cases with a predominant component of DCIS (e.g., DCIS with microinvasion) but may not be necessary for cases of EIC negative invasive carcinomas.

ListItem.name: LI_31342
ListItem.title: Estimated size (extent) of DCIS is at least in Millimeters (mm)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_31342_1
Property.val: Estimated size (extent) of DCIS is at least (Millimeters)

Question.name: Q_16325
Question.title: Architectural Patterns (if DCIS is present in specimen select all that apply)

Question.name: Q_16321
Question.title: Nuclear Grade (if DCIS is present in specimen, see Table 2 in CAP Protocol)

Question.name: Q_16333
Question.title: Necrosis (If DCIS is present in specimen)

ListItem.name: LI_16335
ListItem.title: Present, focal (small foci or single cell necrosis)

Section.name: S_16403
Section.title: Tumor Extent (required only if the structures are present and involved) (Note H)

ListItem.name: LI_16410
ListItem.title: Invasive carcinoma directly invades into the dermis or epidermis without skin ulceration (this does not change the T classification)

ListItem.name: LI_16411
ListItem.title: Invasive carcinoma directly invades into the dermis or epidermis with skin ulceration (classified as T4b)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_42419
DisplayedItem.title: Note: Satellite skin nodules must be separate from the primary tumor and macroscopically identified to assign a category as T4b. Skin nodules identified only on microscopic examination and in the absence of epidermal ulceration or skin edema (clinical peau d'orange) do not qualify as T4b. Such tumors should be categorized based on tumor size.

ListItem.name: LI_16417
ListItem.title: Satellite skin foci of invasive carcinoma are present (i.e., not contiguous with the invasive carcinoma in the breast) (classified as T4b)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_16417_1
Property.val: Satellite skin foci of invasive carcinoma are present

DisplayedItem.name: DI_16419
DisplayedItem.title: Note: This finding does not change the T classification of invasive carcinomas.

ListItem.name: LI_16421
ListItem.title: ?DCIS does not involve the nipple epidermis

Property.name: p_rptTxt_16421_1
Property.val: DCIS does not involve the nipple epidermis

ListItem.name: LI_16422
ListItem.title: DCIS involves nipple epidermis (Paget disease of the nipple)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_16424
DisplayedItem.title: Note: Invasion into pectoralis muscle is not considered chest wall invasion, and cancers are not classified as T4a unless there is invasion deeper than this muscle.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_16426_1
Property.val: Skeletal muscle is free of carcinoma

ListItem.name: LI_16428
ListItem.title: Carcinoma invades into skeletal muscle and into the chest wall (classified as T4a)

Question.name: Q_16455
Question.title: Treatment Effect in the Breast (Note K)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_56693
DisplayedItem.title: Note: The largest contiguous focus of residual tumor, if present, is used to determine ypT category. Treatment-related fibrosis in the tumor bed adjacent to foci of residual invasive carcinoma is not included in determining ypT dimension.

ListItem.name: LI_16457
ListItem.title: No definite response to presurgical therapy in the invasive carcinoma

ListItem.name: LI_16458
ListItem.title: Probable or definite response to presurgical therapy in the invasive carcinoma

ListItem.name: LI_16459
ListItem.title: No residual invasive carcinoma is present in the breast after presurgical therapy

Question.name: Q_37850
Question.title: ?Treatment Effect in the Lymph Nodes (required if nodes are submitted and it is known that the patient had presurgical therapy)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_37850_1
Property.val: Treatment Effect in the Lymph Nodes

DisplayedItem.name: DI_38398
DisplayedItem.title: Note: The largest contiguous focus of residual tumor in the lymph nodes, if present, is used to determine ypN category. Treatment-related fibrosis adjacent to residual nodal deposits is not included in determining ypN dimension.

ListItem.name: LI_16463
ListItem.title: No definite response to presurgical therapy in metastatic carcinoma

ListItem.name: LI_16464
ListItem.title: Probable or definite response to presurgical therapy in metastatic carcinoma

ListItem.name: LI_42410
ListItem.title: No lymph node metastases. Fibrous scarring or histiocytic aggregates, possibly related to prior lymph node metastases with pathologic complete response

ListItem.name: LI_42427
ListItem.title: No lymph node metastases and no fibrous scarring or histiocytic aggregates in the nodes

DisplayedItem.name: DI_42424
DisplayedItem.title: Note: Margin status is listed as “positive” if there is ink on invasive carcinoma (ie, the distance is 0 mm). Extent of margin involvement may be specified as unifocal, multifocal, or extensive.

ListItem.name: LI_38397
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable (residual invasive carcinoma not present in specimen)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_38397_1
Property.val: Not applicable (residual invasive carcinoma not present in specimen)

Question.name: Q_54168
Question.title: Distance from Closest Margin in Millimeters (mm)

Section.name: S_16584
Section.title: Distance from Other Margins (specify millimeter distance including greater than if appropriate)

Section.name: S_42724
Section.title: Distance from Other Margins (specify millimeter distance including greater than if appropriate)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_42430
DisplayedItem.title: Note: For specimens in which the margin is uninvolved (no ink on carcinoma), the closest margin(s) must be specified if the distance of DCIS from the margin is less than 2 mm. Distances can be specific measurements or expressed as greater than or less than a measurement.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_45132
DisplayedItem.title: Note: Margin status is listed as “positive” if there is ink on DCIS (ie, the distance is 0 mm). Extent of margin involvement may be specified as unifocal, multifocal, or extensive.

ListItem.name: LI_16639
ListItem.title: Uninvolved by DCIS (DCIS present in specimen)

Question.title: Distance of DCIS from Closest Margin in Millimeters (mm)

Section.title: Distance of DCIS from Other Margins (specify millimeter distance including greater than if appropriate)

ListItem.title: No lymph nodes submitted or found

Section.name: S_16717
Section.title: PATHOLOGIC STAGE CLASSIFICATION (pTNM, AJCC 8th Edition) (Note M)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_42624
DisplayedItem.title: Note: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_42624_1
Property.val: Note: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_16732
DisplayedItem.title: # For the purposes of this checklist, these categories should only be used in the setting of preoperative (neoadjuvant) therapy for which a previously diagnosed invasive carcinoma is no longer present after treatment. Patients with pathological complete response (absence of residual invasive carcinoma in both the breast and lymph nodes) should be categorized as ypT0N0 or ypTisN0, not ypTX.

ListItem.name: LI_16727
ListItem.title: pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed

ListItem.name: LI_16728
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor#

DisplayedItem.name: DI_38400
DisplayedItem.title: ## Carcinomas in the breast parenchyma associated with Paget disease are categorized based on the size and characteristics of the parenchymal disease, although the presence of Paget disease should still be noted.

ListItem.name: LI_38369
ListItem.title: pTis (Paget): Paget disease of the nipple NOT associated with invasive carcinoma and / or carcinoma in situ (DCIS) in the underlying breast parenchyma##

DisplayedItem.name: DI_57428
DisplayedItem.title: pT1: Tumor <= 20 mm in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_16734
ListItem.title: pT1mi: Tumor <= 1 mm in greatest dimension

DisplayedItem.name: DI_38370
DisplayedItem.title: ### Round any measurement > 1.0-1.9 mm to 2 mm

ListItem.name: LI_16735
ListItem.title: pT1a: Tumor > 1 mm but <= 5 mm in greatest dimension###

ListItem.name: LI_16736
ListItem.title: pT1b: Tumor > 5 mm but <= 10 mm in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_16737
ListItem.title: pT1c: Tumor > 10 mm but <= 20 mm in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_16738
ListItem.title: pT2: Tumor > 20 mm but <= 50 mm in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_16739
ListItem.title: pT3: Tumor > 50 mm in greatest dimension

DisplayedItem.name: DI_46722
DisplayedItem.title: #### Note: Invasion of the dermis alone does not qualify as pT4.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_56309
DisplayedItem.title: pT4: Tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and / or to the skin (ulceration or skin nodules)####

ListItem.name: LI_38401
ListItem.title: pT4a: Extension to the chest wall; invasion or adherence to pectoralis muscle in the absence of invasion of chest wall structures does not qualify as T4

ListItem.name: LI_16743
ListItem.title: pT4b: Ulceration and / or ipsilateral satellite nodules and / or edema (including peau d'orange) of the skin which do not meet the criteria for inflammatory carcinoma

ListItem.name: LI_16744
ListItem.title: pT4c: Both T4a and T4b are present

DisplayedItem.name: DI_21449
DisplayedItem.title: ##### Inflammatory carcinoma requires the presence of clinical findings of erythema and edema involving at least one-third or more of the skin of the breast (see "Note M").

DisplayedItem.name: DI_51050
DisplayedItem.title: Note: The (sn) modifier is added to the N category when a sentinel node biopsy is performed (using either dye or tracer) and fewer than six lymph nodes are removed (sentinel and nonsentinel). The (f) modifier is added to the N category to denote confirmation of metastasis by fine needle aspiration/core needle biopsy with NO further resection of nodes.

ListItem.name: LI_41577
ListItem.title: (sn): Sentinel node(s) evaluated. If 6 or more nodes (sentinel or nonsentinel) are removed, this modifier should not be used.

ListItem.name: LI_43979
ListItem.title: (f): Nodal metastasis confirmed by fine needle aspiration or core needle biopsy.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_45654
DisplayedItem.title: Choose a category based on lymph nodes received with the specimen; immunohistochemistry and / or molecular studies are not required.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_4256
DisplayedItem.title: Note: If internal mammary lymph nodes, infraclavicular nodes, or supraclavicular lymph nodes are included in the specimen, consult the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual for additional lymph node categories.

ListItem.name: LI_16754
ListItem.title: pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed (e.g., not removed for pathologic study or previously removed )

DisplayedItem.name: DI_49198
DisplayedItem.title: # Isolated tumor cells (ITCs) are defined as small clusters of cells not greater than 0.2 mm or single tumor cells, or a cluster of fewer than 200 cells in a single histologic cross-section. ITCs may be detected by routine histology or by immunohistochemical (IHC) methods. Nodes containing only ITCs are excluded from the total positive node count for purposes of N classification but should be included in the total number of nodes evaluated.

ListItem.name: LI_38649
ListItem.title: pN0: No regional lymph node metastasis identified or ITCs only#

ListItem.name: LI_38422
ListItem.title: pN0 (i+): ITCs only (malignant cell clusters no larger than 0.2 mm) in regional lymph node(s)

ListItem.name: LI_38423
ListItem.title: pN0 (mol+): Positive molecular findings by reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT- PCR); no ITCs detected

ListItem.name: LI_38424
ListItem.title: pN1mi: Micrometastases (approximately 200 cells, larger than 0.2 mm, but none larger than 2.0 mm)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_54376
DisplayedItem.title: ## Approximately 1000 tumor cells are contained in a 3-dimensional 0.2-mm cluster. Thus, if more than 200 individual tumor cells are identified as single dispersed tumor cells or as a nearly confluent elliptical or spherical focus in a single histologic section of a lymph node, there is a high probability that more than 1000 cells are present in the lymph node. In these situations, the node should be classified as containing a micrometastasis (pN1mi). Cells in different lymph node cross-sections or longitudinal sections or levels of the block are not added together; the 200 cells must be in a single node profile even if the node has been thinly sectioned into multiple slices. It is recognized that there is substantial overlap between the upper limit of the ITC and the lower limit of the micrometastasis categories due to inherent limitations in pathologic nodal evaluation and detection of minimal tumor burden in lymph nodes. Thus, the threshold of 200 cells in a single cross-section is a guideline to help pathologists distinguish between these 2 categories. The pathologist should use judgment regarding whether it is likely that the cluster of cells represents a true micrometastasis or is simply a small group of isolated tumor cells.

ListItem.name: LI_16765
ListItem.title: pN1a: Metastases in 1-3 axillary lymph nodes, at least one metastasis larger than 2.0 mm##

ListItem.name: LI_46802
ListItem.title: pN1b: Metastases in ipsilateral internal mammary sentinel nodes, excluding ITCs

ListItem.name: LI_16768
ListItem.title: pN2a: Metastases in 4-9 axillary lymph nodes (at least one tumor deposit larger than 2.0 mm)##

ListItem.name: LI_58120
ListItem.title: pN2b: Metastases in clinically detected internal mammary lymph nodes with or without microscopic confirmation; with pathologically negative axillary nodes

ListItem.name: LI_38431
ListItem.title: pN3a: Metastases in 10 or more axillary lymph nodes (at least one tumor deposit larger than 2.0 mm)##

ListItem.name: LI_46347
ListItem.title: pN3b: pN1a or pN2a in the presence of cN2b (positive internal mammary nodes by imaging); or pN2a in the presence of pN1b

ListItem.name: LI_59869
ListItem.title: pN3c: Metastases in ipsilateral supraclavicular lymph nodes

ListItem.name: LI_16778
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_16778_1
Property.val: Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

ListItem.name: LI_16780
ListItem.title: pM1: Histologically proven metastases larger than 0.2 mm

DisplayedItem.title: Note: The CAP Breast Biomarker Template should be used for reporting biomarkers requested for this resection specimen. Pending biomarker studies should be listed in the Comments section of this report.
